alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 10:34AM CST until December 30 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Wilkin and Richland Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. .Excessive rain of around 1 to 2.5 inches has fallen across the southern Red River basin over the previous 72 hours. This rain has fallen over patchy frozen and saturated ground, helping much of this rain runoff into river systems, leading to river rises. Addition flows moving north from the Bois de Sioux near Lake Traverse are also contributing to river rises. Minor flooding is expected in some locations within the southern basin. For the Red River...including Wahpeton, Hickson, Fargo, Halstad, East Grand Forks, Oslo, Drayton, Pembina...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wild Rice River (ND)...including Abercrombie...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.0 feet Friday. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 445 PM CST.
